Dear all,

I am developing an software application that uses Cantera for ki=
netics computations. It 
currently uses a year-old version of Cantera with =
a few modifications. A few weeks ago, I 
updated to the most recent version=
 of Cantera from CVS. This new version fails in the 
ReactorNet's advance()=
 method with the following error:

CVode-- At t=3D0.000313532, mxstep=3D200=
00 steps taken on this call before reaching 
tout=3D0.00032.

*************=
***********************************
                   Cantera Error!      =
            
************************************************
Procedure: CV=
odeInt
Error:      CVode error encountered.

I have been able to track the =
problem through the CVode() function into ReactorNet's eval() 
method, but =
have been unable to definitively track the problem further. I have verified=
 that 
the problem is not with CVode, but with the ReactorNet::eval() metho=
d.

At first, I thought this might be the result of the modifications I hav=
e made to Cantera, so I 
tried to verify the problem with the kinetics_exam=
ple1.cpp file from the most recent 
version of Cantera (without my modifica=
tions). This example file results in the same error.

The new version of Ca=
ntera takes 5 minutes, 21 seconds to execute the 
kinetics_example1.cpp whi=
le the old version only takes 2.33 seconds. Also, the new 
version never co=
rrectly works since it exits prematurely.

I was wondering if anyone was aw=
are of this problem or knew what might be the problem? 
Any input or sugges=
tions would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

Michael Lee
Software Engineer=

CFD Research Corporation
